HSF Newsletters

The HSF Newsletter is an occasional series of longer articles about the HSF, discussing workshops and other big activities. New newsletter articles are always announced on the hsf-forum.

HSF-OSG-WLCG Workshop at Jefferson Lab, HOW2019

03 Apr 2019 by Graeme Stewart

The annual HEP Software Foundation workshop happened in Jefferson Laboratory from the 18th to 22nd of March. This year we had the opportunity to join forces again with the Worldwide LHC Computing Grid (WLCG) community and, in addition, the US...

WLCG-HSF Workshop in Naples

10 Apr 2018 by Graeme Stewart

The WLCG-HSF joint workshop took place in Naples from 26-29 of March. There was a great deal of interest in the event, with 211 people registering, far exceeding the size of any workshop hosted by WLCG or HSF alone. The...

CWP, Naples Workshop and GSoC

25 Jan 2018 by Graeme Stewart

CWP Roadmap The Community White Paper process, that the HSF launched in San Diego in January 2017 came to a successful conclusion at the end of last year, with the publication of A Roadmap for HEP Software and Computing R&D...

Community White Paper (CWP) Workshop, San Diego, 23-26 January 2017

01 Feb 2017 by John Harvey

Realizing the physics programs of the planned and/or upgraded HEP experiments over the next 10 years will require the HEP community to address a number of challenges in the area of software and computing. It is expected that the computing...

Third HSF Workshop

17 May 2016 by Michel Jouvin

Third HSF Workshop (May 2-4, 2016) The HSF had its third workshop at LAL (Orsay, France) on May 2-4, 2016. It was well attended (70 people) representing many different laboratories, universities and institutions (~30) from both sides of the Atlantic,...

Welcome to the HSF Newsletter

13 May 2015 by Torre Wenaus

This is a regular newsletter to inform the community of developments across the HEP Software Foundation activity areas. For information on how this website is put together see here.
